Exiting system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        boolean continueRunning = true;\n        while (continueRunning) {\n            displayMainMenu();\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "1":\n                    executeModifyDataWorkflow();\n                    break;\n                case "2":\n                    searchRefreshmentPoints();\n                    break;\n                case "3":\n                    viewAllRefreshmentPoints();\n                    break;\n                case "4":\n                    System.out.println("Logging out...");\n                    isLoggedIn = false;\n                    continueRunning = false;\n                    break;\n                case "5":\n                    System.out.println("Exiting system. Goodbye!");\n                    continueRunning = false;\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please enter 1-5.");\n            }\n            \n            if (continueRunning) {\n                System.out.println("\\nPress Enter to continue...");\n                scanner.nextLine();\n            }\n        }\n        \n        scanner.close();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Implements the login process as per entry condition: "The agency has logged."\n     * \n     * @return true if login successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean login() {\n        System.out.println("=== AGENCY LOGIN ===");\n        System.out.print("Enter Agency ID: ");\n        String agencyId = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        System.out.print("Enter Password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        // Simple authentication for demonstration\n        // In a real system, this would validate against a database\n        if (agencyId.isEmpty() || password.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Login failed: Agency ID and password are required.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simple validation - in production this would be more secure\n        if (agencyId.equals("agency") && password.equals("password")) {\n            System.out.println("Login successful! Welcome, Agency Operator.");\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            return true;\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Login failed: Invalid credentials.");\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays the main menu to the user.\n     */\n    private void displayMainMenu() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== MAIN MENU ===");\n        System.out.println("1. Modify Refreshment Point Data");\n        System.out.println("2. Search Refreshment Points");\n        System.out.println("3. View All Refreshment Points");\n        System.out.println("4. Logout");\n        System.out.println("5. Exit System");\n        System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-5): ");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Executes the complete Modify Data workflow as described in the use case.\n     * This method implements all steps from the flow of events.\n     */\n    private void executeModifyDataWorkflow() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== MODIFY REFRESHMENT POINT DATA ===");\n        \n        // Step 1: View list of points and select one\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select a Refreshment Point ---");\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> searchResults = performSearch();\n        \n        if (searchResults.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No refreshment points found. Returning to main menu.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Filter to show only active and functional points as per use case\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> activePoints = searchResults.stream()\n                .filter(RefreshmentPoint::isActiveAndFunctional)\n                .toList();\n        \n        if (activePoints.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No active and functional refreshment points found.");\n            System.out.println("Only active and functional points can be modified.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nActive and Functional Refreshment Points:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < activePoints.size(); i++) {\n            System.out.printf("%d. %s\\n", i + 1, activePoints.get(i));\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nSelect a refreshment point (enter number) or 0 to cancel: ");\n        int selection = readIntInput(0, activePoints.size());\n        \n        if (selection == 0) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        RefreshmentPoint selectedPoint = activePoints.get(selection - 1);\n        \n        // Step 2: Load and display form\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Current Data Loaded ---");\n        System.out.println(selectedPoint.toDetailedString());\n        \n        // Create a copy for modification\n        RefreshmentPoint modifiedPoint = selectedPoint.copy();\n        \n        // Step 3: Display modification form and collect changes\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 3: Modify Data ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter new values (press Enter to keep current value):");\n        \n        collectFormInputs(modifiedPoint);\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate data and ask for confirmation\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Validation and Confirmation ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition)\n        if (!service.checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Operation aborted due to server connection issue.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        RefreshmentPointService.ValidationResult validationResult = \n                service.validateRefreshmentPoint(modifiedPoint);\n        \n        if (!validationResult.isValid()) {\n            System.out.println("\\nVALIDATION ERRORS:");\n            System.out.println(validationResult.getFormattedErrors());\n            System.out.println("Activating error handling (use case Errored)...");\n            handleErrorCase(validationResult);\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 5: Confirm operation\n        System.out.println("\\nData validation successful.");\n        boolean confirmed = service.confirmModification(selectedPoint, modifiedPoint);\n        \n        if (!confirmed) {\n            System.out.println("Modification not confirmed. Operation cancelled.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 6: Store modified data\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 6: Storing Modified Data ---");\n        \n        // Block input controls to prevent multiple submissions as per quality requirement\n        System.out.println("Input controls blocked to prevent multiple submissions...");\n        \n        boolean storageSuccess = service.storeModifiedRefreshmentPoint(modifiedPoint);\n        \n        if (storageSuccess) {\n            System.out.println("\\nSUCCESS: Refreshment point data has been updated.");\n            System.out.println("The system has reported the information required by the point of rest.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("\\nERROR: Failed to store modified data.");\n            System.out.println("Please try again or contact system administrator.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs a search for refreshment points as described in Step 1.\n     * \n     * @return list of refreshment points matching search criteria\n     */\n    private List<RefreshmentPoint> performSearch() {\n        System.out.print("Enter search term (or press Enter to view all): ");\n        String searchTerm = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return service.searchRefreshmentPoints(searchTerm);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collects form inputs from the user for modifying a refreshment point.\n     * Implements Step 3 of the use case: "Change data in the form"\n     * \n     * @param point the refreshment point to modify\n     */\n    private void collectFormInputs(RefreshmentPoint point) {\n        System.out.printf("Name [%s]: ", point.getName());\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setName(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Location [%s]: ", point.getLocation());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setLocation(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Description [%s]: ", point.getDescription() != null ? point.getDescription() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setDescription(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Facilities [%s]: ", point.getFacilities() != null ? point.getFacilities() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setFacilities(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Status (ACTIVE/INACTIVE/UNDER_MAINTENANCE) [%s]: ", point.getStatus());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toUpperCase();\n        if (!input.isEmpty() && (input.equals("ACTIVE") || input.equals("INACTIVE") || input.equals("UNDER_MAINTENANCE"))) {\n            point.setStatus(input);\n        } else if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid status. Keeping current value.");\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Functional (true/false) [%s]: ", point.isFunctional());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        if (!input.isEmpty() && (input.equals("true") || input.equals("false"))) {\n            point.setFunctional(Boolean.parseBoolean(input));\n        } else if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid value. Keeping current value.");\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Capacity [%d]: ", point.getCapacity());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            try {\n                int capacity = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                if (capacity >= 0) {\n                    point.setCapacity(capacity);\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("Capacity cannot be negative. Keeping current value.");\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid number format. Keeping current value.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Contact Phone [%s]: ", point.getContactPhone() != null ? point.getContactPhone() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setContactPhone(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Contact Email [%s]: ", point.getContactEmail() != null ? point.getContactEmail() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setContactEmail(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Operating Hours [%s]: ", point.getOperatingHours() != null ? point.getOperatingHours() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setOperatingHours(input);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles the error case as described in Step 4 of use case.\n     * "Where the data is invalid or insufficient, the system activates the use case Errored."\n     * \n     * @param validationResult the validation result containing error details\n     */\n    private void handleErrorCase(RefreshmentPointService.ValidationResult validationResult) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== ERROR HANDLING ACTIVATED ===");\n        System.out.println("The following issues were found with your data:");\n        System.out.println(validationResult.getFormattedErrors());\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nOptions:");\n        System.out.println("1. Return to form and correct errors");\n        System.out.println("2. Cancel operation");\n        System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-2): ");\n        \n        int choice = readIntInput(1, 2);\n        \n        if (choice == 1) {\n            System.out.println("Returning to form...");\n            // In a real implementation, this would return to the form\n            // For simplicity, we\'ll just return to main menu\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled due to errors.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Implements the SearchRefreshmentPoint use case mentioned in Step 1.\n     * Allows user to search for refreshment points.\n     */\n    private void searchRefreshmentPoints() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== SEARCH REFRESHMENT POINTS ===");\n        System.out.print("Enter search term: ");\n        String searchTerm = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        List<RefreshmentPoint> results = service.searchRefreshmentPoints(searchTerm);\n        \n        if (results.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No refreshment points found matching your search.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("\\nSearch Results:");\n            System.out.println("Found " + results.size() + " refreshment point(s):");\n            \n            for (int i = 0; i < results.size(); i++) {\n                RefreshmentPoint point = results.get(i);\n                String statusIndicator = point.isActiveAndFunctional() ? "[ACTIVE]" : "[INACTIVE/MAINTENANCE]";\n                System.out.printf("%d. %s %s - %s\\n", \n                    i + 1, statusIndicator, point.getName(), point.getLocation());\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all refreshment points in the system.\n     */\n    private void viewAllRefreshmentPoints() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== ALL REFRESHMENT POINTS ===");\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = service.searchRefreshmentPoints("");\n        \n        if (allPoints.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No refreshment points in the system.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Total refreshment points: " + allPoints.size());\n            \n            int activeCount = (int) allPoints.stream()\n                    .filter(RefreshmentPoint::isActiveAndFunctional)\n                    .count();\n            \n            System.out.println("Active and functional: " + activeCount);\n            System.out.println("Inactive/maintenance: " + (allPoints.size() - activeCount));\n            System.out.println();\n            \n            for (RefreshmentPoint point : allPoints) {\n                System.out.println(point);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Helper method to read integer input with validation.\n     * \n     * @param min minimum valid value\n     * @param max maximum valid value\n     * @return the validated integer input\n     */\n    private int readIntInput(int min, int max) {\n        while (true) {\n            try {\n                String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n                int value = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                \n                if (value >= min && value <= max) {\n                    return value;\n                } else {\n                    System.out.printf("Please enter a number between %d and %d: ", min, max);\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.printf("Invalid input. Please enter a number between %d and %d: ", min, max);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates the "Operator Agency cancels the operation" exit condition.\n     * This can be called from various points in the workflow.\n     */\n    public void cancelOperation() {\n        System.out.println("\\nOperation cancelled by agency operator.");\n        service.cancelOperation();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if user is currently logged in.\n     * \n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully completed task 3 by creating the UserInterface.java file. private boolean isValidPhone(String phone) {\n        String phoneRegex = "^[0-9\\\\s\\\\-\\\\(\\\\)]+$";\n        return phone.matches(phoneRegex);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the java.util.ArrayList;\nimport java.util.List;\nimport java.util.Scanner;\nimport java.util.stream.Collectors;\n\n/**\n * RefreshmentPointService handles the business logic for managing refreshment points.\n * This service provides methods for searching, loading, modifying, validating, \n * and storing refreshment point data as per the use case requirements.\n */\npublic class RefreshmentPointService {\n    \n    // File path for storing refreshment point data\n    private static final String DATA_FILE = "refreshment_points.dat";\n    \n    // Lock mechanism to prevent multiple submissions as per quality requirement\n    private boolean operationInProgress = false;\n    \n    /**\n     * Searches for refreshment points based on a search term.\n     * This simulates the "SearchRefreshmentPoint" use case mentioned in the requirements.\n     * \n     * @param searchTerm the term to search for in names and locations\n     * @return list of refreshment points matching the search criteria\n     */\n    public List<RefreshmentPoint> searchRefreshmentPoints(String searchTerm) {\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = loadAllRefreshmentPoints();\n        \n        if (searchTerm == null || searchTerm.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return allPoints;\n        }\n        \n        String term = searchTerm.toLowerCase();\n        return allPoints.stream()\n                .filter(rp -> \n                    (rp.getName() != null && rp.getName().toLowerCase().contains(term)) ||\n                    (rp.getLocation() != null && rp.getLocation().toLowerCase().contains(term)) ||\n                    (rp.getId() != null && rp.getId().toLowerCase().contains(term))\n                )\n                .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Loads a refreshment point by its ID.\n     * \n     * @param id the ID of the refreshment point to load\n     * @return the refreshment point if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    public RefreshmentPoint loadRefreshmentPoint(String id) {\n        if (id == null || id.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = loadAllRefreshmentPoints();\n        return allPoints.stream()\n                .filter(rp -> id.equals(rp.getId()))\n                .findFirst()\n                .orElse(null);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates a refreshment point\'s data for modification.\n     * This method performs comprehensive validation as per the use case requirement.\n     * \n     * @param refreshmentPoint the refreshment point to validate\n     * @return ValidationResult containing validation status and any error messages\n     */\n    public ValidationResult validateRefreshmentPoint(RefreshmentPoint refreshmentPoint) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        if (refreshmentPoint == null) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Refreshment point cannot be null");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check essential fields\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getId() == null || refreshmentPoint.getId().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("ID is required");\n        }\n        \n        if (refreshmentPoint.getName() == null || refreshmentPoint.getName().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Name is required");\n        }\n        \n        if (refreshmentPoint.getLocation() == null || refreshmentPoint.getLocation().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Location is required");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate status\n        String status = refreshmentPoint.getStatus();\n        if (status != null) {\n            String upperStatus = status.toUpperCase();\n            if (!upperStatus.equals("ACTIVE") && !upperStatus.equals("INACTIVE") && \n                !upperStatus.equals("UNDER_MAINTENANCE")) {\n                result.setValid(false);\n                result.addErrorMessage("Status must be ACTIVE, INACTIVE, or UNDER_MAINTENANCE");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate capacity\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getCapacity() < 0) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Capacity cannot be negative");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email format if provided\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getContactEmail() != null && !refreshmentPoint.getContactEmail().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            String emailRegex = "^[A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+@(.+)$";\n            if (!refreshmentPoint.getContactEmail().matches(emailRegex)) {\n                result.setValid(false);\n                result.addErrorMessage("Invalid email format");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate phone format if provided\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getContactPhone() != null && !refreshmentPoint.getContactPhone().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            String phoneRegex = "^[0-9\\\\s\\\\-\\\\(\\\\)]+$";\n            if (!refreshmentPoint.getContactPhone().matches(phoneRegex)) {\n                result.setValid(false);\n                result.addErrorMessage("Invalid phone number format");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // If no errors were added, the data is valid\n        if (result.getErrorMessages().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(true);\n        }\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Stores the modified refreshment point data.\n     * This method handles the "Stores the modified data" step from the use case.\n     * \n     * @param refreshmentPoint the modified refreshment point to store\n     * @return true if storage was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean storeModifiedRefreshmentPoint(RefreshmentPoint refreshmentPoint) {\n        if (refreshmentPoint == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot store null refreshment point");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!refreshmentPoint.validate()) {\n            System.err.println("Refreshment point data is invalid");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if operation is already in progress (prevent multiple submissions)\n        if (operationInProgress) {\n            System.err.println("Operation already in progress. Please wait for completion.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Lock the operation to prevent multiple submissions\n        operationInProgress = true;\n        \n        try {\n            // Load all existing points\n            List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = loadAllRefreshmentPoints();\n            \n            // Find and replace the point with the same ID\n            boolean found = false;\n            for (int i = 0; i < allPoints.size(); i++) {\n                if (refreshmentPoint.getId().equals(allPoints.get(i).getId())) {\n                    allPoints.set(i, refreshmentPoint);\n                    found = true;\n                    break;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // If not found, add as new\n            if (!found) {\n                allPoints.add(refreshmentPoint);\n            }\n            \n            // Save all points back to file\n            if (saveAllRefreshmentPoints(allPoints)) {\n                System.out.println("Successfully stored modified refreshment point: " + refreshmentPoint.getName());\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.err.println("Failed to save refreshment point data");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.err.println("Error storing refreshment point: " + e.getMessage());\n            e.printStackTrace();\n            return false;\n        } finally {\n            // Unlock the operation\n            operationInProgress = false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirms the modification operation.\n     * This simulates the confirmation step from the use case.\n     * \n     * @param originalPoint the original refreshment point (for comparison)\n     * @param modifiedPoint the modified refreshment point\n     * @return true if confirmed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean confirmModification(RefreshmentPoint originalPoint, RefreshmentPoint modifiedPoint) {\n        if (originalPoint == null || modifiedPoint == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\n=== CONFIRMATION REQUIRED ===");\n        System.out.println("You are about to modify the following refreshment point:");\n        System.out.println();\n        System.out.println("ORIGINAL DATA:");\n        System.out.println(originalPoint.toDetailedString());\n        System.out.println();\n        System.out.println("MODIFIED DATA:");\n        System.out.println(modifiedPoint.toDetailedString());\n        System.out.println();\n        \n        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n        System.out.print("Do you confirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String confirmation = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        \n        return confirmation.equals("yes") || confirmation.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates server connection interruption as mentioned in exit conditions.\n     * \n     * @return true if connection is available, false if interrupted\n     */\n    public boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // In a real application, this would check actual server connectivity\n        // For simulation, we\'ll randomly determine connection status (90% chance of success)\n        double random = Math.random();\n        boolean connected = random < 0.9; // 90% chance of being connected\n        \n        if (!connected) {\n            System.err.println("ERROR: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n        }\n        \n        return connected;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Loads all refreshment points from the data file.\n     * \n     * @return list of all refreshment points\n     */\n    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")\n    private List<RefreshmentPoint> loadAllRefreshmentPoints() {\n        File file = new File(DATA_FILE);\n        \n        // If file doesn\'t exist, create some sample data\n        if (!file.exists()) {\n            createSampleData();\n        }\n        \n        try (ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream(new FileInputStream(DATA_FILE))) {\n            return (List<RefreshmentPoint>) ois.readObject();\n        } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {\n            System.err.println("Data file not found: " + e.getMessage());\n        } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error loading refreshment points: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        // Return empty list if loading fails\n        return new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Saves all refreshment points to the data file.\n     * \n     * @param refreshmentPoints list of refreshment points to save\n     * @return true if save was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean saveAllRefreshmentPoints(List<RefreshmentPoint> refreshmentPoints) {\n        try (ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(DATA_FILE))) {\n            oos.writeObject(refreshmentPoints);\n            return true;\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error saving refreshment points: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates sample refreshment point data for testing/demonstration.\n     */\n    private void createSampleData() {\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> samplePoints = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        samplePoints.add(new RefreshmentPoint(\n                "RP001", \n                "Mountain View Rest Area", \n                "Highway 101, Mile Marker 45",\n                "Scenic rest area with mountain views",\n                "Restrooms, Picnic Tables, Water Fountain, Vending Machines",\n                "ACTIVE",\n                true,\n                50,\n                "(555) 123-4567",\n                "mountainview@etour.example.com",\n                "24/7"\n        ));\n        \n        samplePoints.add(new RefreshmentPoint(\n                "RP002", \n                "Riverside Park Stop", \n                "Downtown Riverfront",\n                "Urban park with rest facilities",\n                "Restrooms, Benches, Tourist Information, Café",\n                "ACTIVE",\n                true,\n                100,\n                "(555) 987-6543",\n                "riverside@etour.example.com",\n                "6:00 AM - 10:00 PM"\n        ));\n        \n        samplePoints.add(new RefreshmentPoint(\n                "RP003", \n                "Forest Trail Rest Point", \n                "National Forest, Trailhead 3",\n                "Rest point along hiking trail",\n                "Water Source, Basic Shelter, Trash Bins",\n                "UNDER_MAINTENANCE",\n                false,\n                20,\n                "(555) 456-7890",\n                "foresttrail@etour.example.com",\n                "Dawn to Dusk"\n        ));\n        \n        try (ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(DATA_FILE))) {\n            oos.writeObject(samplePoints);\n            System.out.println("Created sample refreshment point data.");\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error creating sample data: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Inner class to represent validation results.\n     * This is used to return both validation status and error messages.\n     */\n    public static class ValidationResult {\n        private boolean isValid;\n        private List<String> errorMessages;\n        \n        public ValidationResult() {\n            this.isValid = false;\n            this.errorMessages = new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        public boolean isValid() {\n            return isValid;\n        }\n        \n        public void setValid(boolean valid) {\n            this.isValid = valid;\n        }\n        \n        public List<String> getErrorMessages() {\n            return errorMessages;\n        }\n        \n        public void addErrorMessage(String message) {\n            this.errorMessages.add(message);\n        }\n        \n        public String getFormattedErrors() {\n            if (errorMessages.isEmpty()) {\n                return "No errors";\n            }\n            \n            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n            sb.append("Validation Errors:\\n");\n            for (String error : errorMessages) {\n                sb.append("  - ").append(error).append("\\n");\n            }\n            return sb.toString();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if an operation is already in progress.\n     * Used to prevent multiple submissions as per quality requirements.\n     * \n     * @return true if an operation is in progress, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isOperationInProgress() {\n        return operationInProgress;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Cancels the current operation.\n     * This handles the "Operator Agency cancels the operation" exit condition.\n     */\n    public void cancelOperation() {\n        if (operationInProgress) {\n            operationInProgress = false;\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by agency operator.");\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully completed task 2 View list of points of rest (from SearchRefreshmentPoint)\n * 2. Load and display form for selected point\n * 3. Collect user modifications\n * 4. Validate data and ask for confirmation\n * 5. Handle confirmation or error\n * 6. Store modified data\n */\npublic class UserInterface {\n    private RefreshmentPointService service;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    private boolean isLoggedIn;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor initializes the UserInterface with required dependencies.\n     */\n    public UserInterface() {\n        this.service = new RefreshmentPointService();\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main entry point for the user interface.\n     * Implements the complete flow described in the use case.\n     */\n    public void start() {\n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        System.out.println("   Refreshment Point Management System    ");\n        System.out.println("      Modify Data (Agency Operator)       ");\n        System.out.println("==========================================");\n        System.out.println();\n        \n        // Entry condition: Agency must be logged in\n        if (!login()) {\n            System.out.println("Login failed. Exiting system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        boolean continueRunning = true;\n        while (continueRunning) {\n            displayMainMenu();\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "1":\n                    executeModifyDataWorkflow();\n                    break;\n                case "2":\n                    searchRefreshmentPoints();\n                    break;\n                case "3":\n                    viewAllRefreshmentPoints();\n                    break;\n                case "4":\n                    System.out.println("Logging out...");\n                    isLoggedIn = false;\n                    continueRunning = false;\n                    break;\n                case "5":\n                    System.out.println("Exiting system. Goodbye!");\n                    continueRunning = false;\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please enter 1-5.");\n            }\n            \n            if (continueRunning) {\n                System.out.println("\\nPress Enter to continue...");\n                scanner.nextLine();\n            }\n        }\n        \n        scanner.close();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Implements the login process as per entry condition: "The agency has logged."\n     * \n     * @return true if login successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean login() {\n        System.out.println("=== AGENCY LOGIN ===");\n        System.out.print("Enter Agency ID: ");\n        String agencyId = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        System.out.print("Enter Password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        // Simple authentication for demonstration\n        // In a real system, this would validate against a database\n        if (agencyId.isEmpty() || password.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Login failed: Agency ID and password are required.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simple validation - in production this would be more secure\n        if (agencyId.equals("agency") && password.equals("password")) {\n            System.out.println("Login successful! Welcome, Agency Operator.");\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            return true;\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Login failed: Invalid credentials.");\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays the main menu to the user.\n     */\n    private void displayMainMenu() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== MAIN MENU ===");\n        System.out.println("1. Modify Refreshment Point Data");\n        System.out.println("2. Search Refreshment Points");\n        System.out.println("3. View All Refreshment Points");\n        System.out.println("4. Logout");\n        System.out.println("5. Exit System");\n        System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-5): ");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Executes the complete Modify Data workflow as described in the use case.\n     * This method implements all steps from the flow of events.\n     */\n    private void executeModifyDataWorkflow() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== MODIFY REFRESHMENT POINT DATA ===");\n        \n        // Step 1: View list of points and select one\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select a Refreshment Point ---");\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> searchResults = performSearch();\n        \n        if (searchResults.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No refreshment points found. Returning to main menu.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Filter to show only active and functional points as per use case\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> activePoints = searchResults.stream()\n                .filter(RefreshmentPoint::isActiveAndFunctional)\n                .toList();\n        \n        if (activePoints.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No active and functional refreshment points found.");\n            System.out.println("Only active and functional points can be modified.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nActive and Functional Refreshment Points:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < activePoints.size(); i++) {\n            System.out.printf("%d. %s\\n", i + 1, activePoints.get(i));\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nSelect a refreshment point (enter number) or 0 to cancel: ");\n        int selection = readIntInput(0, activePoints.size());\n        \n        if (selection == 0) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by operator.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        RefreshmentPoint selectedPoint = activePoints.get(selection - 1);\n        \n        // Step 2: Load and display form\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Current Data Loaded ---");\n        System.out.println(selectedPoint.toDetailedString());\n        \n        // Create a copy for modification\n        RefreshmentPoint modifiedPoint = selectedPoint.copy();\n        \n        // Step 3: Display modification form and collect changes\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 3: Modify Data ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter new values (press Enter to keep current value):");\n        \n        collectFormInputs(modifiedPoint);\n        \n        // Step 4: Validate data and ask for confirmation\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Validation and Confirmation ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection (exit condition)\n        if (!service.checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Operation aborted due to server connection issue.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        RefreshmentPointService.ValidationResult validationResult = \n                service.validateRefreshmentPoint(modifiedPoint);\n        \n        if (!validationResult.isValid()) {\n            System.out.println("\\nVALIDATION ERRORS:");\n            System.out.println(validationResult.getFormattedErrors());\n            System.out.println("Activating error handling (use case Errored)...");\n            handleErrorCase(validationResult);\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 5: Confirm operation\n        System.out.println("\\nData validation successful.");\n        boolean confirmed = service.confirmModification(selectedPoint, modifiedPoint);\n        \n        if (!confirmed) {\n            System.out.println("Modification not confirmed. Operation cancelled.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 6: Store modified data\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 6: Storing Modified Data ---");\n        \n        // Block input controls to prevent multiple submissions as per quality requirement\n        System.out.println("Input controls blocked to prevent multiple submissions...");\n        \n        boolean storageSuccess = service.storeModifiedRefreshmentPoint(modifiedPoint);\n        \n        if (storageSuccess) {\n            System.out.println("\\nSUCCESS: Refreshment point data has been updated.");\n            System.out.println("The system has reported the information required by the point of rest.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("\\nERROR: Failed to store modified data.");\n            System.out.println("Please try again or contact system administrator.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs a search for refreshment points as described in Step 1.\n     * \n     * @return list of refreshment points matching search criteria\n     */\n    private List<RefreshmentPoint> performSearch() {\n        System.out.print("Enter search term (or press Enter to view all): ");\n        String searchTerm = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return service.searchRefreshmentPoints(searchTerm);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Collects form inputs from the user for modifying a refreshment point.\n     * Implements Step 3 of the use case: "Change data in the form"\n     * \n     * @param point the refreshment point to modify\n     */\n    private void collectFormInputs(RefreshmentPoint point) {\n        System.out.printf("Name [%s]: ", point.getName());\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setName(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Location [%s]: ", point.getLocation());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setLocation(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Description [%s]: ", point.getDescription() != null ? point.getDescription() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setDescription(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Facilities [%s]: ", point.getFacilities() != null ? point.getFacilities() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setFacilities(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Status (ACTIVE/INACTIVE/UNDER_MAINTENANCE) [%s]: ", point.getStatus());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toUpperCase();\n        if (!input.isEmpty() && (input.equals("ACTIVE") || input.equals("INACTIVE") || input.equals("UNDER_MAINTENANCE"))) {\n            point.setStatus(input);\n        } else if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid status. Keeping current value.");\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Functional (true/false) [%s]: ", point.isFunctional());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        if (!input.isEmpty() && (input.equals("true") || input.equals("false"))) {\n            point.setFunctional(Boolean.parseBoolean(input));\n        } else if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid value. Keeping current value.");\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Capacity [%d]: ", point.getCapacity());\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            try {\n                int capacity = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                if (capacity >= 0) {\n                    point.setCapacity(capacity);\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("Capacity cannot be negative. Keeping current value.");\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid number format. Keeping current value.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Contact Phone [%s]: ", point.getContactPhone() != null ? point.getContactPhone() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setContactPhone(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Contact Email [%s]: ", point.getContactEmail() != null ? point.getContactEmail() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setContactEmail(input);\n        }\n        \n        System.out.printf("Operating Hours [%s]: ", point.getOperatingHours() != null ? point.getOperatingHours() : "");\n        input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n            point.setOperatingHours(input);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles the error case as described in Step 4 of use case.\n     * "Where the data is invalid or insufficient, the system activates the use case Errored."\n     * \n     * @param validationResult the validation result containing error details\n     */\n    private void handleErrorCase(RefreshmentPointService.ValidationResult validationResult) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== ERROR HANDLING ACTIVATED ===");\n        System.out.println("The following issues were found with your data:");\n        System.out.println(validationResult.getFormattedErrors());\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nOptions:");\n        System.out.println("1. Return to form and correct errors");\n        System.out.println("2. Cancel operation");\n        System.out.print("Enter your choice (1-2): ");\n        \n        int choice = readIntInput(1, 2);\n        \n        if (choice == 1) {\n            System.out.println("Returning to form...");\n            // In a real implementation, this would return to the form\n            // For simplicity, we\'ll just return to main menu\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled due to errors.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Implements the SearchRefreshmentPoint use case mentioned in Step 1.\n     * Allows user to search for refreshment points.\n     */\n    private void searchRefreshmentPoints() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== SEARCH REFRESHMENT POINTS ===");\n        System.out.print("Enter search term: ");\n        String searchTerm = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        List<RefreshmentPoint> results = service.searchRefreshmentPoints(searchTerm);\n        \n        if (results.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No refreshment points found matching your search.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("\\nSearch Results:");\n            System.out.println("Found " + results.size() + " refreshment point(s):");\n            \n            for (int i = 0; i < results.size(); i++) {\n                RefreshmentPoint point = results.get(i);\n                String statusIndicator = point.isActiveAndFunctional() ? "[ACTIVE]" : "[INACTIVE/MAINTENANCE]";\n                System.out.printf("%d. %s %s - %s\\n", \n                    i + 1, statusIndicator, point.getName(), point.getLocation());\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays all refreshment points in the system.\n     */\n    private void viewAllRefreshmentPoints() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== ALL REFRESHMENT POINTS ===");\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = service.searchRefreshmentPoints("");\n        \n        if (allPoints.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No refreshment points in the system.");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Total refreshment points: " + allPoints.size());\n            \n            int activeCount = (int) allPoints.stream()\n                    .filter(RefreshmentPoint::isActiveAndFunctional)\n                    .count();\n            \n            System.out.println("Active and functional: " + activeCount);\n            System.out.println("Inactive/maintenance: " + (allPoints.size() - activeCount));\n            System.out.println();\n            \n            for (RefreshmentPoint point : allPoints) {\n                System.out.println(point);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Helper method to read integer input with validation.\n     * \n     * @param min minimum valid value\n     * @param max maximum valid value\n     * @return the validated integer input\n     */\n    private int readIntInput(int min, int max) {\n        while (true) {\n            try {\n                String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n                int value = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                \n                if (value >= min && value <= max) {\n                    return value;\n                } else {\n                    System.out.printf("Please enter a number between %d and %d: ", min, max);\n                }\n            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                System.out.printf("Invalid input. Please enter a number between %d and %d: ", min, max);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates the "Operator Agency cancels the operation" exit condition.\n     * This can be called from various points in the workflow.\n     */\n    public void cancelOperation() {\n        System.out.println("\\nOperation cancelled by agency operator.");\n        service.cancelOperation();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if user is currently logged in.\n     * \n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully completed task 3 by creating the UserInterface.java file.  // Check that essential fields are not null or empty\n        if (id == null || id.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (name == null || name.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (location == null || location.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate status is one of the allowed values\n        if (status != null) {\n            String upperStatus = status.toUpperCase();\n            if (!upperStatus.equals("ACTIVE") && !upperStatus.equals("INACTIVE") && \n                !upperStatus.equals("UNDER_MAINTENANCE")) {\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate capacity is non-negative\n        if (capacity < 0) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email format if provided\n        if (contactEmail != null && !contactEmail.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            if (!isValidEmail(contactEmail)) {\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate phone format if provided\n        if (contactPhone != null && !contactPhone.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            if (!isValidPhone(contactPhone)) {\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simple email validation using regex pattern.\n     * \n     * @param email the email to validate\n     * @return true if email format is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean isValidEmail(String email) {\n        String emailRegex = "^[A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+@(.+)$";\n        return email.matches(emailRegex);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simple phone validation - allows digits, spaces, parentheses, and hyphens.\n     * \n     * @param phone the phone number to validate\n     * @return true if phone format is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean isValidPhone(String phone) {\n        String phoneRegex = "^[0-9\\\\s\\\\-\\\\(\\\\)]+$";\n        return phone.matches(phoneRegex);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the refreshment point is active and functional.\n     * This is used to determine if it can be selected for modification.\n     * \n     * @return true if the point is active and functional, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isActiveAndFunctional() {\n        return "ACTIVE".equalsIgnoreCase(status) && isFunctional;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a string representation of the refreshment point.\n     * Useful for displaying in lists.\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return String.format("ID: %s, Name: %s, Location: %s, Status: %s, Functional: %s",\n                id, name, location, status, isFunctional ? "Yes" : "No");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Returns a detailed string representation of the refreshment point.\n     * Useful for displaying full details.\n     */\n    public String toDetailedString() {\n        return String.format(\n                "Refreshment Point Details:\\n" +\n                "ID: %s\\n" +\n                "Name: %s\\n" +\n                "Location: %s\\n" +\n                "Description: %s\\n" +\n                "Facilities: %s\\n" +\n                "Status: %s\\n" +\n                "Functional: %s\\n" +\n                "Capacity: %d\\n" +\n                "Contact Phone: %s\\n" +\n                "Contact Email: %s\\n" +\n                "Operating Hours: %s",\n                id, name, location, \n                description != null ? description : "Not provided",\n                facilities != null ? facilities : "Not provided",\n                status,\n                isFunctional ? "Yes" : "No",\n                capacity,\n                contactPhone != null ? contactPhone : "Not provided",\n                contactEmail != null ? contactEmail : "Not provided",\n                operatingHours != null ? operatingHours : "Not provided"\n        );\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Compares refreshment points for equality based on ID.\n     */\n    @Override\n    public boolean equals(Object obj) {\n        if (this == obj) return true;\n        if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) return false;\n        RefreshmentPoint that = (RefreshmentPoint) obj;\n        return Objects.equals(id, that.id);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Generates hash code based on ID.\n     */\n    @Override\n    public int hashCode() {\n        return Objects.hash(id);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a copy of this refreshment point.\n     * \n     * @return a new RefreshmentPoint with the same data\n     */\n    public RefreshmentPoint copy() {\n        return new RefreshmentPoint(\n                id, name, location, description, facilities, status, \n                isFunctional, capacity, contactPhone, contactEmail, operatingHours\n        );\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully completed task 1 by creating the RefreshmentPoint.java file. matching the search criteria\n     */\n    public List<RefreshmentPoint> searchRefreshmentPoints(String searchTerm) {\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = loadAllRefreshmentPoints();\n        \n        if (searchTerm == null || searchTerm.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return allPoints;\n        }\n        \n        String term = searchTerm.toLowerCase();\n        return allPoints.stream()\n                .filter(rp -> \n                    (rp.getName() != null && rp.getName().toLowerCase().contains(term)) ||\n                    (rp.getLocation() != null && rp.getLocation().toLowerCase().contains(term)) ||\n                    (rp.getId() != null && rp.getId().toLowerCase().contains(term))\n                )\n                .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Loads a refreshment point by its ID.\n     * \n     * @param id the ID of the refreshment point to load\n     * @return the refreshment point if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    public RefreshmentPoint loadRefreshmentPoint(String id) {\n        if (id == null || id.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = loadAllRefreshmentPoints();\n        return allPoints.stream()\n                .filter(rp -> id.equals(rp.getId()))\n                .findFirst()\n                .orElse(null);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates a refreshment point\'s data for modification.\n     * This method performs comprehensive validation as per the use case requirement.\n     * \n     * @param refreshmentPoint the refreshment point to validate\n     * @return ValidationResult containing validation status and any error messages\n     */\n    public ValidationResult validateRefreshmentPoint(RefreshmentPoint refreshmentPoint) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        if (refreshmentPoint == null) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Refreshment point cannot be null");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check essential fields\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getId() == null || refreshmentPoint.getId().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("ID is required");\n        }\n        \n        if (refreshmentPoint.getName() == null || refreshmentPoint.getName().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Name is required");\n        }\n        \n        if (refreshmentPoint.getLocation() == null || refreshmentPoint.getLocation().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Location is required");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate status\n        String status = refreshmentPoint.getStatus();\n        if (status != null) {\n            String upperStatus = status.toUpperCase();\n            if (!upperStatus.equals("ACTIVE") && !upperStatus.equals("INACTIVE") && \n                !upperStatus.equals("UNDER_MAINTENANCE")) {\n                result.setValid(false);\n                result.addErrorMessage("Status must be ACTIVE, INACTIVE, or UNDER_MAINTENANCE");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate capacity\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getCapacity() < 0) {\n            result.setValid(false);\n            result.addErrorMessage("Capacity cannot be negative");\n        }\n        \n        // Validate email format if provided\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getContactEmail() != null && !refreshmentPoint.getContactEmail().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            String emailRegex = "^[A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+@(.+)$";\n            if (!refreshmentPoint.getContactEmail().matches(emailRegex)) {\n                result.setValid(false);\n                result.addErrorMessage("Invalid email format");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate phone format if provided\n        if (refreshmentPoint.getContactPhone() != null && !refreshmentPoint.getContactPhone().trim().isEmpty()) {\n            String phoneRegex = "^[0-9\\\\s\\\\-\\\\(\\\\)]+$";\n            if (!refreshmentPoint.getContactPhone().matches(phoneRegex)) {\n                result.setValid(false);\n                result.addErrorMessage("Invalid phone number format");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // If no errors were added, the data is valid\n        if (result.getErrorMessages().isEmpty()) {\n            result.setValid(true);\n        }\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Stores the modified refreshment point data.\n     * This method handles the "Stores the modified data" step from the use case.\n     * \n     * @param refreshmentPoint the modified refreshment point to store\n     * @return true if storage was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean storeModifiedRefreshmentPoint(RefreshmentPoint refreshmentPoint) {\n        if (refreshmentPoint == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot store null refreshment point");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!refreshmentPoint.validate()) {\n            System.err.println("Refreshment point data is invalid");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if operation is already in progress (prevent multiple submissions)\n        if (operationInProgress) {\n            System.err.println("Operation already in progress. Please wait for completion.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Lock the operation to prevent multiple submissions\n        operationInProgress = true;\n        \n        try {\n            // Load all existing points\n            List<RefreshmentPoint> allPoints = loadAllRefreshmentPoints();\n            \n            // Find and replace the point with the same ID\n            boolean found = false;\n            for (int i = 0; i < allPoints.size(); i++) {\n                if (refreshmentPoint.getId().equals(allPoints.get(i).getId())) {\n                    allPoints.set(i, refreshmentPoint);\n                    found = true;\n                    break;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // If not found, add as new\n            if (!found) {\n                allPoints.add(refreshmentPoint);\n            }\n            \n            // Save all points back to file\n            if (saveAllRefreshmentPoints(allPoints)) {\n                System.out.println("Successfully stored modified refreshment point: " + refreshmentPoint.getName());\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.err.println("Failed to save refreshment point data");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.err.println("Error storing refreshment point: " + e.getMessage());\n            e.printStackTrace();\n            return false;\n        } finally {\n            // Unlock the operation\n            operationInProgress = false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirms the modification operation.\n     * This simulates the confirmation step from the use case.\n     * \n     * @param originalPoint the original refreshment point (for comparison)\n     * @param modifiedPoint the modified refreshment point\n     * @return true if confirmed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean confirmModification(RefreshmentPoint originalPoint, RefreshmentPoint modifiedPoint) {\n        if (originalPoint == null || modifiedPoint == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n System.out.println(modifiedPoint.toDetailedString());\n        System.out.println();\n        \n        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n        System.out.print("Do you confirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String confirmation = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        \n        return confirmation.equals("yes") || confirmation.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates server connection interruption as mentioned in exit conditions.\n     * \n     * @return true if connection is available, false if interrupted\n     */\n    public boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // In a real application, this would check actual server connectivity\n        // For simulation, we\'ll randomly determine connection status (90% chance of success)\n        double random = Math.random();\n        boolean connected = random < 0.9; // 90% chance of being connected\n        \n        if (!connected) {\n            System.err.println("ERROR: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n        }\n        \n        return connected;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Loads all refreshment points from the data file.\n     * \n     * @return list of all refreshment points\n     */\n    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")\n    private List<RefreshmentPoint> loadAllRefreshmentPoints() {\n        File file = new (ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream(new FileInputStream(DATA_FILE))) {\n            return (List<RefreshmentPoint>) ois.readObject();\n        } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {\n            System.err.println("Data file not found: " + e.getMessage());\n        } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error loading refreshment points: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        // Return empty list if loading fails\n        return new ArrayList<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Saves all refreshment points to the data file.\n     * \n     * @param refreshmentPoints list of refreshment points to save\n     * @return true if save was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean saveAllRefreshmentPoints(List<RefreshmentPoint> refreshmentPoints) {\n        try (ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(DATA_FILE))) {\n            oos.writeObject(refreshmentPoints);\n            return true;\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error saving refreshment points: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates sample refreshment point data for testing/demonstration.\n     */\n    private void createSampleData() {\n        List<RefreshmentPoint> is used to return both validation status and error messages.\n     */\n    public static class ValidationResult {\n        private boolean isValid;\n        private List<String> errorMessages;\n        \n        public ValidationResult() {\n            this.isValid = false;\n            this.errorMessages = new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        public boolean isValid() {\n            return isValid;\n        }\n        \n        public void setValid(boolean valid) {\n            this.isValid = valid;\n        }\n        \n        public List<String> getErrorMessages() {\n            return errorMessages;\n        }\n        \n        public void addErrorMessage(String message) {\n            this.errorMessages.add(message);\n        }\n        \n        public String getFormattedErrors() {\n            if (errorMessages.isEmpty()) {\n                return "No errors";\n            }\n            \n            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n            sb.append("Validation Errors:\\n");\n            for (String error : errorMessages) {\n                sb.append("  - ").append(error).append("\\n");\n            }\n            return sb.toString();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if an operation is already in progress.\n     * Used to prevent multiple submissions as per quality requirements.\n     * \n     *
